bioghist.p: Col. John H. Taggart (d. 1892), was the founder of Taggart's Times, a Philadelphia newspaper. His descendants include Henry Taggart (1846-1893), who died of Bright's disease, William Marcus Taggart (b.1852), Harry L. Taggart (d. 1919), Harry E. Taggart, and Marianne Taggart.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of business and personal papers of the Taggart family. Materials include business correspondence, leases, insurance policies, rent fees, wills, legal records and some family correspondence. The real estate material largely deals with properties in Philadelphia, Cape May, and Atlantic City. The collection also includes cabinet cards, cyanotypes, tintypes, and mounted photographs, some of which are identified. Highlights include shots of the exterior of the "Taggarts' Times" building in Philadelphia and several photographs taken at the Jersey shore. The collection also has some materials related to the Savage family, especially the Reverend William Savage, and a published Gee family genealogy.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
